content.description: Stand start with hand compressing the opposing features. From there, gain the great feet while bumping the right hand up the arete, reach the lip, and mantel atop the boulder.
content.protection: A pair of pads. There is a good landing, but a rock sits just right of the problem.
content.location: It climbs the center of Rib Cage's north face.

content.description: Stand start with your choice of hold. From there, ascend the slab using the prominent undercling, reach the edges, and mantel on top the cliff line.
content.protection: A pair of pads. There is a good landing, don't pitch off the back though.
content.location:
Climb the cliff line directly behind the

Rib Cage

problem.

content.description:
Start down low in a sloper hueco like pocket. Make a series of moves up to the crux where you hit 3 razor sharp crimpers. Move with surgical precission through these crimps up to a fun topout.

Hope your crimp strength is up!!

In my opinion, this is probably one of the best lines in this canyon.
content.location: This route, from the main area and The Weeping Boulder, head right, along the trail - past The Abyss Boulder and follow the trail. There are 4 trailmarkers that lead you right to the Rib Cage Boulder where there are many various problems.

content.description: SDS matching on nice hold in lower right corner, move up to the nice sloper, then go all the way to the left.
content.location: This is on The Rib Cage Boulder, up the hill from The Bat Cave.

content.description: Start on a diagonal rail and move out right and up. eventually hitting the crux mono pocket move... very fun and challenging.
content.location:
This route is around to the left of

Surgical Procedure

on the same boulder.

content.description:
Start on 2 small crimps and make a few moves up on very thin crimps as well to the ledge.... IMO, it is not worth it to top out this guy once you gain the fatty lege and stand up - it is not worth breaking a back topping out on choss.

This is a good problem up to the big ledge though.
content.location:
It is on the same HUGE boulder as

Mono Pocket Rocket

but directly on the other side of the boulder.

content.description:
My modest little contribution to this great spot: this is a must-do problem for the boulderer with a trad climber's eye.

Sit Start at some jugs and make easy throws to gain a good looking thin crack. As the crack thins and cruxes up HIGH throw out right to some nubbins. Committing, delicate, and fun.
content.location:
In between

Mono Pocket Rocket

and

Surgical Procedure

. Look for the obvious tips/finger crack.

This is on the west face of the rib cage boulder, in the pleasant little corridor that stays shady and cool even in summer.
